title: Japan Launches X-Ray Telescope and Lunar Lander
summary: Weather finally cooperated and Japan’s space agency was able to launch its new x-ray telescope, XRISM, and lunar lander, SLIM. A lot is riding on both missions. The telescope is […]

title: Japan launches moon lander and X-ray observatory
summary: Japan sent a new X-ray space telescope into low Earth orbit and a first, small lunar lander on its way to the moon with a single launch late Wednesday.

title: SpaceChain pivots to combine AI with Earth imagery
summary: The Singapore startup known for sending blockchain nodes into space is rolling out a service that integrates artificial intelligence with Earth imagery.

title: Psyche asteroid mission set for October launch
summary: A NASA mission to a large metallic asteroid is on track to launch in October after more than a year of delays, but the mission faces a potential challenge to those plans beyond the agency’s control.

title: L3Harris Selects Firefly To Launch US National Security Satellites
summary: Firefly Aerospace has signed an agreement with L3Harris Technologies to conduct three dedicated missions on Firefly's Alpha rocket. The satellites are currently being designed and constructed by L3Harris, under a $225 million contract awarded by the U.S. government.
